This issue is known to be solved with [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra) userscript.

If youre using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

* [Install for Chrome, Edge or other Chromium-based browsers](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Install for Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

comment.body:
For the amp version of the site, if you add this rule:  `the-sun.com##.amp-adv-wrapper` then the adverts leftover will be hidden?
The top of the site on the full version is missing due to the Fanboy's Annoyances filter, please disable this filter or add:
`the-sun.com#@#.sticky-social` to the user rules.

issue.title: Add tracking domains used by Japanese TV stations

labels.name: A: In progress

comment.body:
I have inspected the packets using Wireshark and I found that:
there is missing domain (beat.yourtv.jp), and all telemetries except one were sent in plaintext.

![0A6EE658-7B29-46A6-993E-5CB5CF410AA7](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/98938086/203982983-50052168-bb08-40fe-a98f-86ee15e0b455.jpeg)
![54B3C4D6-EAF2-497F-A8D5-31D4208B7F3D](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/98938086/203983003-0ff2542c-e122-434e-aae6-c2d203d8f5a6.jpeg)

The underlined DNS queries are all telemetry made by my smart TV. I also have Wireshark log which can be sent directly to you upon request. I decided not to upload it here because it contains my TVs identifies as well as postal code (although its fake).

### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);

- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for Android

### AdGuard version

4 nighify 36

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed ads or ad leftovers

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Chrome

### Which device do you use?

Mobile

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://truyenqqpro.com/truyen-tranh/sakurai-san-wa-kizuite-hoshii-8558-chap-10.html

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. this is the omission in the filter. I can fix it by adding the following 2 filters:
```ablocklist
truyenqqpro.com###ad_info_top
truyenqqpro.com###ad_info
```


2. Screenshots
<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45375496/203974187-3fef028a-0e31-4288-9ac8-6de9d247b3c5.png)

</details>

comment.body:
> added rule for `the-sun.com`, filters update should be available in 1-2 hours

There is still a leftover there for me:
The rules that solves for me:
```

the-sun.com##section.amp-layout:nth-child(11) > div.amp-layout-div.t-p-color:first-child > div.article__content.theme-news > div.social-box:nth-child(2)

```

comment.body:
This:
```adblock
t-online.de#%#(()=>{window.XMLHttpRequest.prototype.send=new Proxy(window.XMLHttpRequest.prototype.send,{apply:(a,b,c)=>{const d=b.urlCalled;return"string"!=typeof d||0===d.length?Reflect.apply(a,b,c):d.match(/\.damoh\./)?void 0:Reflect.apply(a,b,c)}})})();
```
seems to works on `t-online.de`, but it might be required to click two times on a player (I guess that it's better than ads).

comment.body:
We have these platforms:
```
adguard_app_windows      -- AG for Windows
adguard_app_mac             -- AG for Mac
adguard_app_android        -- AG for Android
adguard_app_ios                -- AG for iOS
adguard_ext_chromium      -- AG browser extension for Chrome
adguard_ext_firefox          -- AG browser extension for Firefox
adguard_ext_edge             -- AG browser extension for Edge
adguard_ext_safari            -- AG browser extension for Safari
adguard_ext_opera            -- AG browser extension for Opera
adguard_ext_android_cb    -- AG content blocker for Samsung/Yandex
ext_ublock                           -- uBlock
```
Where this rule must be applied? And why it must be applied to not all platforms?

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for Windows, Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

AdGuard for Windows 7.11.1 + uBO 1.45.2

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Chrome

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

chrome-extension://cjpalhdlnbpafiamejdnhcphjbkeiagm/dashboard.html#3p-filters.html

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, List-KR

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. I figured I should give a quick headsup that the attempt to add whitelistings in AdGuard Base for `/adservice.` currently aren't working entirely correctly, since uBO would sync List-KR from its own extension settings, instead of while the browser GUI is visiting any of the three `$domain=~` domains.

I see two possible fixes:
*My recommended way:* `@@/adservice.txt?_=` (Appears to work correctly in Dandelion Sprout's Annoyances List.) + potentially `@@||adservice.io^$~third-party`?
*An alternative way:* `@@||githubusercontent.com/*/adservice.` + `@@||github.com/*/adservice.` + `@@||adservice.io^`

3. Screenshots
<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22780683/203341738-437ba74e-03fa-48d2-a907-ddff4cf666a0.png)

</details>

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
The issue is caused by `Frellwit's Swedish Filter`, please disable this filter or add this rules to the User Rules.
```
yubico.com#@#div.cli-modal-backdrop
yubico.com#@##cliSettingsPopup.cli-modal
```

```
gdpr-tcfv2.sp-prod.net$domain=~autobild.de|~computerbild.de
```

What is the problem with this rules?

Thanks for help

comment.body:
The problem is that extension for Opera/Firefox cannot update/download new JavaScript rules, so please add this rule:
```adblock
welt.de,t-online.de#%#(()=>{ window.XMLHttpRequest.prototype.send=new Proxy(window.XMLHttpRequest.prototype.send,{apply:(a,b,c)=>{const d=b.urlCalled;return"string"!=typeof d||0===d.length?Reflect.apply(a,b,c):d.match(/\.damoh\./)?void 0:Reflect.apply(a,b,c)}})})();
```
to user rules.

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 10 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).
